newsitem.title: UK: Grade pledges "continuity" at First Leisure.
newsitem.headline: Grade pledges "continuity" at First Leisure.

text.p: Michael Grade said on Wednesday that "continuity not change" would be his motto when he takes over as full-time executive chairman of First Leisure Plc later this year.
"Anyone who is expecting radical change will be disappointed," said Grade, who is resigning as chief executive of Channel 4 television. "This is a very successful company."
"We have a major development programme ongoing. That is where the growth of the company is coming from. That is the strategy," he added.
First Leisure is spending 55 million stg on new sites this year alone as part of an investment programme worth a total of 100 million stg.
"I think I have a feel for what entertains the British public," added Grade, when pressed on what he would bring to First Leisure.
